description: This file defines the AppLocalizations class for managing multi-language support in a Flutter application. It provides localized strings for different parts of the app based on the user's locale, including support for Hindi, Gujarati, and English. It also contains a delegate class for localization setup.

classes.name: AppLocalizations
classes.description: Handles the retrieval of localized strings based on the current locale.

classes.name: _AppLocalizationsDelegate
classes.description: A delegate class responsible for loading and supporting localizations for the app.

methods.name: AppLocalizations.of
methods.description: Retrieves the current instance of AppLocalizations from the context.

methods.name: AppLocalizations.load
methods.description: Loads the localization data for a given locale.

methods.name: AppLocalizations.get discoverBabyNames
methods.description: Returns the localized string for 'Discover Baby Names'.

methods.name: AppLocalizations.get searchNames
methods.description: Returns the localized string for 'Search names...'.

methods.name: AppLocalizations.get noNamesFound
methods.description: Returns the localized string for 'No names found'.

methods.name: _AppLocalizationsDelegate.isSupported
methods.description: Checks if a locale is supported.

methods.name: _AppLocalizationsDelegate.load
methods.description: Loads the localization data for the supported locale.

methods.name: _AppLocalizationsDelegate.shouldReload
methods.description: Indicates whether the delegate should reload if previous delegate changes.
